title: Noon Year's Eve
description: Ring in the new year with family crafts, treats and a special 3-2-1 countdown to 12:00pm!  Please register each child, caretakers do not need to register.

title: Breakfast with Santa
description:
To welcome Santa this season the HRCA will be hosting a very special breakfast for the man in red and his festive friends!  Santa and Mrs. Claus will once again make a stop in Highlands Ranch this Christmas season for the annual Breakfast with Santa Event.  Guests are invited to celebrate the magic of the holiday season and enjoy a delicious breakfast buffet with Santa Claus as he travels the globe to visit Eastridge.  Bring your appetite for the best pancakes and sausage this side of the North Pole.  Want to treat your family to a magical morning and make your dreams come true?  Come enjoy sleigh loads of fun at the December 15 Event.  The ‘Jolly Ole Elf’ himself arrives for a 9:00 a.m. start and will be perched in his Royal Chair accompanied by his merry elves until 10:30 a.m. listening to every good child’s special wish for Christmas.  Remember to bring your camera to capture this favorite family tradition. Children may also enjoy creating crafts, writing letters to Santa and listening to festive holiday music and stories from Mrs. Claus in Santa’s Workshop!  
This is an event that even Ebenezer Scrooge would enjoy and is presented by the Highlands Ranch Community Association (HRCA) will be held at the Recreation Center at Eastridge, 9568 University Blvd, Highlands Ranch.  

The event costs $11 in advance and $15 at the door, if not sold out (all ages.)  Everyone needs a ticket to participate.  Children must be accompanied by a paying adult.  Sorry no refunds.

For more information or to purchase tickets for this fun and educational event, simply call 303-791-2500 or visit www.HRCAonline.org.

title: Polar Express Celebration
description: Enjoy a special reading of The Polar Express, with crafts, games and refreshments, at the Philip S. Miller Library in Castle Rock. For all ages. Tuesday, December 3 at 6:30PM.
location: Douglas County Libraries in Highlands Ranch

title: A Storybook Holiday:  The Nutcracker Brunch Edition
description: Description: Join us at our holiday party extravaganza celebrating The Nutcracker! Our Lone Tree location will magically transform into the holiday wonderland of Clara's sugar-plum dreams. Festivities at this whimsical family event include a visit with Santa, live performances of your favorite Nutcracker pieces, music and entertainment, and make-and-take gift stations. The delicious menu of brunch bites includes selections for all appetites, young and old. Create your own hot cocoa concoction at our Cocoa Bar, and enjoy a selection of other beverages. Celebrate the beginning of the holiday season with DCL! Tickets are $22 for adults, $18 for children ages 3-12. An additional mimosa ticket is $15 for adults 21-plus (on-sale date 10/1). Your purchase of a beverage wristband supports the DCL Foundation. No taxpayer funds will be used for the purchase of alcoholic beverages.

title: Carriage Parade Day
description: Festive carolers, hot chocolate treats, holiday crafts and activities, and games will follow the Town of Parker's Carriage Parade.

title: Christmas Carriage Parade
description: The Town of Parker and Colorado Driving Society invite you to experience the Christmas Carriage Parade, an annual downtown Parker tradition. Come and experience that holiday feeling in the air and enjoy this all-equestrian parade.

title: A Storybook Holiday: The Nutcracker
description: Join us at our holiday party extravaganza celebrating The Nutcracker! Our Lone Tree location will magically transform into the holiday wonderland of Clara's sugar-plum dreams. Festivities at this whimsical family event include a visit with Santa, live performances of your favorite Nutcracker vignettes, music and entertainment, and make-and-take gift stations. The delectable menu of light dinner bites includes selections for all appetites, young and old. Create your own hot cocoa concoction at our Cocoa Bar, and enjoy a selection of other beverages. Celebrate the beginning of the holiday season with DCL! Tickets are $25 for adults, $20 for children ages 3-12. Additional beer and wine tickets are $15 for adults 21-plus (on-sale date 10/1). Your purchase of a beverage wristband supports the DCL Foundation. No taxpayer funds will be used for the purchase of alcoholic beverages.
location: Douglas County Library in Lone Tree

title: Polar Express
description: Enjoy a special reading of this beloved story and fun holiday crafts and activities! All Ages.

title: The Polar Express
description: Enjoy a special reading of The Polar Express, plus holiday crafts and games, at the Philip S. Miller Library in Castle Rock. For all ages. Tuesday, December 3 at 7 PM.
location: Douglas County Libraries in Castle Rock, Philip S. Miller Library

title: Starlighting: Stop and Play
description: Celebrate Castle Rock's annual Starlighting with festive events and activities at the Philip S. Miller Library in Castle Rock. For all ages. Saturday, November 23 at 12PM.
location: Douglas County Libraries in Castle Rock, Philip S. Miller Library

title: Mayor's Holiday Lighting
description: Bundle up and bring your family and friends to kick off the holiday season at the Mayor's Holiday Lighting, held annually on the Friday after Thanksgiving at O'Brien Park.

title: Dancing in the Starlight
description: Celebrate Castle Rock's annual Starlighting with festive events and activities at the Philip S. Miller Library in Castle Rock. For all ages. Friday, November 22 at 6PM.
location: Douglas County Libraries in Castle Rock, Philip S. Miller Library

title: Turkey Day 5K FUN Run/Walk
description: Come celebrate the Thanksgiving holiday while getting a workout during the Turkey Day 5K FUN Run/Walk held on Nov. 22 at 8 a.m. starting at the Parker Recreation Center.

title: Local Author Showcase
description: Are you interested in meeting local authors and learning more about their books? Then don't miss our local authors event, where 22 authors will be on hand to discuss their work, followed by a book sale and signing. Light refreshments served. Adults.

title: Frank Sinatra
description:
The Highlands Ranch Cultural Affairs Association is bringing you an evening like no other.  The show promises to keep you thoroughly entertained and on your dancin’ toes! Frank Sinatra and Tuxedo Junction recreates the swing era from the 30’s and 40’s big band era. From swing to Latin rhythms, Tuxedo Junction will keep you dancing the whole night long. This is the show for you that does not stop from the moment the band hits the stage till the last screams from the crowd subsides!
Come and enjoy an evening of classic swing and standards featuring a performance from 'Ol Blue Eyes' and Tuxedo Junction as well as two of Colorado favorite vocal stylists:  Odell Stroud and Aubrie Hamrick.

Very light appetizers included.  Cash bar available.  Purchase from a selection of beer and wine.
Friday, November 9, 2018 • 6:30 – 8:00 p.m.• Highlands Ranch Mansion, 9950 Gateway Blvd, Highlands Ranch (Doors and cash bar open at 6:00 p.m.) • $30 in advance and $35 everyone, day of event, if not sold out. 21+. IDs will be checked • Info:  HRCAonline.org or 303-791-2500

title: An Evening with Whole30's Melissa Hartwig
description: The Whole30 co-founder, sports nutritionist, and author Melissa Hartwig will talk about her new cookbook, Whole30 Slow Cooker, followed by a book sale and signing. Adults.

title: Jewelry & Holiday Gift Fair
description:
There’s something for everyone! 

Looking for special gifts or something truly different to give this holiday, sometimes the best place to look is your local craft fair.  A great alternative to crowded stores is checking gifts off your list at the Jewelry & Holiday Gift Fair, which makes it both easy and fun to browse for you or purchase that unique gift for someone special.  You’ll find everything from home décor items to jewelry to food to ornaments and more, from over 125 exhibits!  You’ll be delighted with the quality and selection.  .Best of all admission is free.  Saturday, November 3 from 9:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m. at the Eastridge Recreation Center at 9568 University Blvd., Highlands Ranch.

title: Fall Fest
description: The whole family can have fun with boo-tacular games, pumpkin-y crafts, tasty treats, and spooky science at this annual autumn festival! Costumes encouraged.

title: Goblin Give Out!
description:
Hey Kids! Wear your Halloween Costumes and Trick or Treat at participating merchants throughout Downtown Littleton. 12:00 - 5:00 pm. 
Sponsored by the Historic Downtown Littleton Merchants Association.

title: Take Me to the River: Memphis Soul and Rhythm and Blues Revue
description: Join the Lone Tree Arts Center on Friday, October 27 at 8pm for Take Me to the River. Take Me to the River is a live performance that brings together legends William Bell, Bobby Rush, and Charlie Musselwhite, in a show that reimagines the utopia of racial, gender, and generational collaboration of Memphis in its heyday.

title: An Evening with Cynthia Swanson
description:
Join the award-winning author of the book club favorite The Bookseller to hear about her new suspense novel, The Glass Forest. Book sale and signing will follow the author's talk.

Cynthia Swanson, award-winning author of book club favorite, The Bookseller, will talk about her latest suspense novel, The Glass Forest, on Tuesday, October 23rd at 6:30 p m at Douglas County Libraries in Parker. Books will be sold at the event and a signing will follow the presentation. For more information and to register, visit dcl.org/authors-events.

title: Fieldhouse Fright Night
description: Fieldhouse Fright Night welcomes ghastly ghouls, spooky spirits and wicked witches of all shapes and sizes to the Parker Fieldhouse on Oct. 20 at 5:30 p.m. for an evening of family-friendly fun!

title: Julian Lage and Chris Eldridge
description: Julian Lage and Chris Eldridge will be at the Lone Tree Arts Center on Wednesday, October 18 at 7:30pm. Their album Mount Royal is a combination of bluegrass and folk, with insinuations of jazz and pop, and hints of classical and avant garde composition that rarely settles into any one particular category. Lage is a Grammy-nominated artist who is a former child prodigy and recognized for his remarkable musical ability. Eldridge studied with bluegrass guitar legend Tony Rice and is well known for being a member of the Seldom Scene, The Infamous Stringdusters, and the Punch Brothers. Don't miss your chance to see this amazingly talented duo at the Lone Tree Arts Center on October 18th at 7:30pm.

title: Steppin' Out with Ben Vereen
description: See the legendary Ben Vereen at the Lone Tree Arts Center on Saturday, October 14th at 8pm. His artistic quality has always been fueled by a passion to channel the arts for a better world. This performance highlights the Tony Award winner's unique artistry, combining a tribute to Broadway and Frank Sinatra. Tickets are selling fast, so don't miss your opportunity to see Ben Vereen at the Lone Tree Arts Center on October 14th at 8pm.

title: Fall Fest
description: 8th Annual Fall Fest. The nights are getting longer and colder, leaves are turning, and everything is pumpkin spiced flavored. It must be fall! Celebrate the season with games, crafts, a green screen photo-booth, and a whole lot of candy. Costumes not required, but definitely encouraged. Hosted by the Teen Library Council.

title: Paranormal
description:
Join the Highlands Ranch Community Association (HRCA) 
for ghost-hunting at the Highlands Ranch Mansion on Thursday, October 10!

Come to the Mansion for the annual Paranormal Party from 6:00 – 9:00 p.m. to discover for yourself whether or not ghosts inhabit the mansion.  Spirit PI will be on hand to lead the hunt. Explore the mansion during cocktail time then attend a presentation of “Things That Go Bump in the Night” by Spirit PI.  They will present paranormal evidence gathered during prior ghost- hunts. Then it is on to ghost hunting with the professionals! Visit their web site to get a peak at what Spirit PI does….www.spiritpi.com. 
Wine and beer will be available to purchase, very light appetizers included with ticket. This will be a unique evening for those 21+ years of age. This event will sellout so please get your tickets today!
	
Tickets are $35 in advance and $40 at the door if not sold out.  Go to HRCAonline.org/Tickets

title: Fall Craft Show
description: This two-day show features a diverse collection of exhibitors creating anything and everything handcrafted. The majority of the crafters are from the Highlands Ranch area and have gone through a rigorous jury to ensure uniqueness of product and quality of craftsmanship. You will be delighted with the high quality market place featuring exclusive exhibitors whose creativity shows in their work. Items include jewelry, bath products, pottery, wooden crafts, floral arrangements, wreaths, baby and children’s articles, fused glass, and hand-knit items. The Fall Craft Show is the perfect place to find that one-of-a-kind handcrafted gift. Best of all, admission is free!

title: Classic Albums Live: Abbey Road
description: Join the Lone Tree Arts Center for Classic Albums Live Abbey Road on Saturday, October 7 at 8pm. Classic Albums Live recreates Abbey Road with skilled vocalists and musicians who honor the work with no gimmicks, no make-up or other illusions employed by tribute bands. Note for note, cut for cut, the attention to detail is staggering; every sound from the album is masterfully duplicated live on stage. Experience a live performance of some of the most recognizable Beatles songs at Classic Albums Live Abbey Road at Lone Tree Arts Center on October 7 at 8pm.

title: Murder on the High Sea" - A Pirate Murder Mystery"
description: Murder on the High Sea is a classic, interactive whodunit with a fantastical pirate twist. Join your friends to solve this interactive mystery! Teens. Roxborough, Friday, October 4, 6PM

title: Castle Rock Oktoberfest
description: Join us for the biggest and best Oktoberfest yet on Saturday, September 29, 2018 from 1pm - 9pm at Wilcox Square in Downtown Castle Rock. This fall festival features free fun like bounce houses, face painters, balloon artists and German dancers. Try your hand at stein hoisting and enjoy food, beverages from local breweries and Bavarian tunes. Free admission.

title: Castle Rock Oktoberfest
description: Join us for the biggest and best Oktoberfest yet on Saturday, September 29, 2018 from 1pm - 9pm at Wilcox Square in Downtown Castle Rock. This fall festival features free fun like bounce houses, face painters, balloon artists and German dancers. Try your hand at stein hoisting and enjoy food, beverages from local breweries and Bavarian tunes. Free admission.

title: Fifth Annual Fete des Fables Gala
description: Spend a magical evening supporting the library at our Fifth Annual Fete des Fables Gala. Adults. Friday, September 27, 6PM, CU South Denver.

title: DCL Presents: Jodi Picoult
description: Douglas County Libraries is excited to host Jodi Picoult, New York Times bestselling author of many beloved novels including My Sister's Keeper, Nineteen Minutes, and Small Great Things. Ms. Picoult will be in conversation with NYT bestselling author Eleanor Brown. Ticket includes a seat at the author's presentation, dessert bites, a pre-signed paperback copy of A Spark of Light, and a place in the photo line.

title: The Company Men
description: Join the Lone Tree Arts Center on Saturday, September 23rd at 8pm to officially open the season with the Company Men. Featuring performers from Broadway and National Touring companies of Hairspray, The Lion King, Jesus Christ Superstar, Camelot, and the Emmy Award-winning NBC mini-series The Temptations, the Company Men bring a signature throwback sound, contemporary look, and an all-star band. Prior to the show, the Lone Tree Arts Center Guild is hosting an opening night gala. Don't miss the Company Men on Saturday, September 23rd at 8pm.

title: Highlands Ranch Oktoberfest
description: Gather your family and friends together for this great cultural event , the Highlands Ranch Oktoberfest on September 22nd starting at 2:00 pm and ending at 10:00 pm located in the Highlands Ranch Town Center.  There will be lots of German food, music, and, of course, great biers from Paulaner. And don't forget the live entertainment! It’s an evening of non-stop entertainment for the kids, too. Children will enjoy magic, balloons, and games until their hearts are content.

title: Doggie Yoga
description:
Yoga relieves stress, lowers blood pressure, and helps improve your mood. But yoga with dogs? Double the benefits!

Join the HRCA as we partner with the Humane Society of the South Platte Valley for Doggie Yoga. Proceeds from each ticket will be donated to HSSPV. Be sure to bring extra cash since the dogs will be collecting donations during yoga! 

The class will start at 9:30 a.m. and will be followed by mingling, breakfast snacks, and puppy love around 10:15 a.m. Yoga will be taught by HRCA's popular Yoga Instructor, Kristi!

Attendees must be 13+ to participate in this event and participants ages 13-17 must have a parent or guardian present at the event to sign a waiver. 

Doggie Yoga is an outdoor event and will be held rain or shine! 

This event is to help dogs from HSSPV get adopted - NO OUTSIDE PETS ARE ALLOWED!

title: Blind Boys of Alabama
description: The Blind Boys of Alabama will be at the Lone Tree Arts Center on Friday, September 15th at 8pm. The Blind Boys of Alabama are not just gospel singers borrowing from old traditions; the group helped to define those traditions in the 20th century and almost single-handedly created a new gospel sound for the 21st century. Don't miss your chance to see these living legends on September 15th at the Lone Tree Arts Center!

title: First Contact: Discovery in the New Guinea Heartland
description: Hear about the remarkable 1974 expedition that led to the first contact with Citak warriors in Indonesian New Guinea from the discovery team's co-leader, Peter Van Arsdale. Van Arsdale, Ph.D, is an applied anthropologist and professor at University of Denver. He will talk about the expedition and share slides and film footage. TEENS & ADULTS. REGISTER NOW.

title: Alpine Search & Rescue: Lessons from Hikes Gone Wrong
description: Stay safe in Colorado's backcountry while hiking, biking, skiing or enjoying time in the mountains with insights and tips from Dean Rosnau, a seasoned search and rescue worker who spent 34 years working in the Sierras. His book, The Shortest Straw, will be on sale at the event. ADULTS. REGISTER NOW.

title: The Alpaca Farm Show
description: Mark your calendars for AlpacaBuddies' Alpaca Farm Show! Alpacas, and the fiber they create, in various forms, will be there, hope you stop by to learn more about raising, owning, and the life of Alpacas! The event will take place at the Douglas County Fairgrounds on September 9th, and 10th from 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM.

title: Barker Days
description: Barker Days, held Sept. 8 from 9 a.m. to 3 p.m., welcomes hundreds of dogs with their owners and features a temporary dog park in the O’Brien Park ball field and H2O’Brien Pool, as well as dog-related vendors.

title: Doggie Splash and Pet Expo
description:
NEW!  9:00 - 10:00 a.m. is reserved for small dogs only. 15 pounds and under and/or 15 inches in height and under.
The Doggie Splash caters to dogs and dog-lovers alike.  Summer is winding down so come and have a ball and cool off with your favorite four-legged friends and family at the Westridge outdoor pool (no humans in the pool,) 9650 Foothills Canyon Blvd, Highlands Ranch.  There is no better place for your ‘Fido’ to escape the summer heat, enjoy a cool dip and splish and splash at our per-friendly bash!.  Bring your canine companion and enjoy the vendors, and camaraderie.  And you don’t have to have a dog to come out.  People can come to visit the many vendors.  Enjoy one of the best gatherings of pet related vendors.   

Saturday, September 7, 2019• 9:00 a.m. – 10:00 a.m. small dog hour, 10:00 a.m. - 1:00 p.m. all social dogs  • Recreation Center at Westridge Outdoor Pool, 9650 Ridgeline Blvd, Highlands Ranch • Admission is $7 in advance, $10 at the door, per dog, and open to the public • Info:  HRCAonline.org or 303-791-2500  • For event status during inclement weather call 303-471-8888.

title: DCL Presents Craig Johnson
description: Beloved author Craig Johnson returns with the latest in his bestselling Longmire series, Depth of Winter. Tickets include the author's presentation, a hardcover copy of Depth of Winter, dessert bites, and a place in the signing line. Additional books will be available for purchase courtesy of Tattered Cover Book Store.

title: Community Street Party and Concert
description: The Community Street Party and Concert is brought to you in partnership between Business Over Beverages and the Downtown Merchants Association. Gather in Festival Park on Tuesday, September 4, 2018 from 5pm - 8pm for networking, live music and adult beverages.

title: Party in the Pines
description: Join us for the annual Castle Pines Party in the Pines; a weekend long celebration including Vino in the Village on Friday, August 25th; Party in the Park on Saturday, August 26th, and Run Wild on Sunday, August 27th. VIno in the Village features wine tasting, food pairings, live music, and shopping at the Village at Castle Pines. Party in the Park, features food, live music, kids activities, vendor booths, beer and wine, with a fireworks display at dusk. The Run Wild event features a 9 mile, 4 mile, and 1K Color Me Wild fun run. Be sure to visit cppartyinthepines.com for ticket information. See you there!
location: Elk Ridge Park and Village Center

title: Taste of Douglas County
description: Join friends and family as they sample food from over 50 restaurants and food service establishments at the 16th annual Taste of Douglas County. It will be held at the indoor, air conditioned Douglas County Events Center on Wednesday, August 23, 2016 from 5 to 8 pm. Tickets and information are available at  www.tasteofdouglascounty.com.

title: Sunday Dinner
description: Join us for a new event, Sunday Dinner, on Sunday, August 19, 2018 from 4pm - 7pm. Bring your family and enjoy dinner in Festival Park. Visit the Downtown Castle Rock Facebook event page for more details closer to the event.

title: So Long to Summer 5K/10K and Family Fun Trek
description: The So Long to Summer 5K/10K and Family Fun Trek, held Aug. 11 at 8 a.m. at Salisbury Park, is a great event to grab your friends and family to run or walk and celebrate the last bit of summer.

title: The Motones
description: Join the Motones for a night of Motown hits at the Lone Tree Arts Center on Friday, August 11 at 8pm. Their repertoire includes hit songs from The Jackson 5, The Temptations, and Marvin Gaye, blended with current hits in the Motown style.

title: Film in the Park
description:
Plan to join the HRCA family summer tradition!  Bring a blanket and enjoy great FREE family movie on Friday August 17th at Civic Green Park starting at dusk!  Mark the date now!  Parental Guidance suggested.  Snacks available for purchase from Cornzapoppin and Kona Ice.

We will be watching the movie Coco at Civic Green Park, 9370 Ridgeline Blvd.   Sorry, no dogs allowed in the park.  For more Information, visit HRCAonline.org or call 303-791-2500.

title: Concert Under the Lights
description: Come to Downtown Castle Rock for a night of music at the Concert Under the Lights, Friday, August 10, 2018 from 6pm - 10pm. Gather under the lights on Wilcox Street for a summer night of music and food. Event held on Wilcox Street between 3rd and 5th Streets. Free parking at the Douglas County garage located at 3rd and Jerry.

title: Film in the Park
description:
Film in the Park
Fridays, August 2, 9, & 16
Civic Green Park
9370 Ridgeline Blvd.
FREE
8:15 p.m. or dusk

Plan to join the HRCA family summer tradition!  Bring a blanket and enjoy great FREE family movies!  Mark the date now!  Parental Guidance suggested.  Snacks available for purchase from Cornzapoppin.
August 2, Mary Poppins Returns*.  August 9, How to Train Your Dragon 3  August 16, Incredibles 2.  
*Come dressed as your favorite character and bring your camera and meet Mary Poppins!
Sorry, no dogs or glass allowed in the park.


Info:  visit HRCAonline.org or call 303-791-2500

title: An Evening with Andrea Bobotis
description: Local author Andrea Bobotis joins us to talk about her debut novel, The Last List of Miss Judith Kratt. Be among the first to hear about it from the author herself! A book sale and signing will follow the author’s talk. Adults.

title: Douglas County Fair and Rodeo
description: The Douglas County Fair and Rodeo is a family tradition featuring two entertainment stages, three PRCA Rodeos, Xtreme Bulls, Carnival, Mutton Bustin', Stick Horse Rodeo, Pancake Breakfast, 4-H and FFA exhibits - including livestock, general projects and the Jr. Livestock Sale.

title: Boots and Brews
description: Join us after the Douglas County Fair Parade for Boots and Brews, 11am - 4pm in Festival Park in Downtown Castle Rock. Celebrate the Town's western heritage and enjoy live music, food, adult beverages from various breweries and free bounce houses and family activities.

title: Western Heritage Welcome
description: Castle Rock's Western Heritage Welcome weekend begins with a longhorn steer drive from our beautiful landmark, Rock Park, and heads south through historic Downtown. This event pays homage to Castle Rock's rich western history, as well as, welcomes the 99th Douglas County Fair and Rodeo taking place the following weekend. As hundreds align Perry Street for a glimpse of the cowboys, longhorns, and their calves, down the road authentic chuck wagons are preparing to give attendees a taste of the old west with slow-cooked, wood-fire methods from that time period. With this sanctioned Chuck Wagon Cook-off, cowboy cocktails, and a country music concert, Western Heritage Welcome draws in hundreds of attendees from the Front Range and beyond and keeps the Old West traditions of Colorado alive.

title: Kids' TRY-athlon
description: Parker Parks and Recreation's Kids' TRY-athlon is a triathlon event for ages 6 to 12 held at the Parker Recreation Center on July 21 starting at 8 a.m.

title: Fun in the Sun
description: Formerly known as Splash in the Park, Fun in the Sun is the same kid-oriented event in July that will be hosted at the Douglas County Fairgrounds. Activities include free bounce houses, water activities and other fun.

title: Starlight Movie Night
description: Come down to Festival Park on July 14, 2018 at 6pm for a street party and starlight movie night showing Coco. Enjoy food vendors on site, family activities, free bounce houses, face painters, balloon artists and more. Movie begins at dusk!

title: Who Stole the Cookies?
description: Help solve a cookie caper! Use your sharp detective skills and forensic science to help Ms. Romero's class solve the mystery of who took the cookies for the bake sale. AGES 6-8. REGISTER NOW.

title: Who Stole the Cookies?
description: Help solve a cookie caper! Use your sharp detective skills and forensic science to help Ms. Romero's class solve the mystery of who took the cookies for the bake sale. AGES 6-8. REGISTER NOW.

title: Who Stole the Cookies?
description: Help solve a cookie caper! Use your sharp detective skills and forensic science to help Ms. Romero's class solve the mystery of who took the cookies for the bake sale. AGES 6-8. REGISTER NOW.

title: The Great Outdoors
description: Experience all the great outdoors has to offer. This month, learn about the basics of hiking a 14er at the Douglas County Libraries in Castle Pines, Thursday July 5th at 5 p.m.   Get expert tips and tricks on routes, equipment, preparedness, technology and fitness.  For more information and to register, visit dcl.org/castle-pines.

title: Parker Stars and Stripes Celebration
description: Celebrate Independence Day at the Town of Parker's Stars and Stripes Celebration at Salisbury Park.  Bring your blankets and lawn chairs and set up for an evening jam packed with family fun. General admission is free, so save the date and come join in on the fun!

title: Bike to Work Day
description: Join thousands of Denver metro-area commuters for Bike to Work Day! Stop by the Town of Parker's breakfast station on your ride into work on the Cherry Creek Trail under the E-470 overpass from 6 to 9 a.m.

title: Author Kirk W. Johnson Presents: The Feather Thief
description: Kirk W. Johnson will talk about the real-life crime that inspired his latest book, The Feather Thief, Tuesday, June 25, 6:30 p.m. at Douglas County Libraries in Highlands Ranch. A book sale and signing will follow his presentation. For more information and to register, visit d c l dot o r g forward slash authors hyphen events.

title: Concert to Benefit Friends of Castlewood Canyon State Park
description:
Friends of Castlewood Canyon State Park is a 501(c)(3) non-profit. It is a group of dedicated volunteers that love Castlewood and are committed to improving the environmental programs at Castlewood. An on-going project is to provide transportation funding to under-served schools. The purpose is to get kids out doors and experience nature. 
The concert will be performed by Mark Cormican, a songwriter, singer, and John Denver Tribute Artist.

title: Explore Pluto with Dr. Alan Stern
description: Planetary Scientist, Dr. Alan Stern, leader of NASA's New Horizons mission to Pluto, will discuss his book Chasing New Horizons, Wednesday, June 22 at 7 PM at Douglas County Libraries in Highlands Ranch. Dr. Stern has been named to the Time 100 twice. Book sales and a signing will follow the presentation.

title: Ninja School
description: Test your ninja skills Saturday, June 22 at 6:30pm at Douglas County Libraries in Parker. The event is aimed at kids aged 7-12. REGISTER NOW.

title: Craig Grossi & Fred
description: Craig Grossi and Fred will talk about their book Craig & Fred: A Marine, A Stray Dog and How they Rescued Each Other, Wednesday, June 20 at 6:30 PM in the Event Hall of Douglas County Libraries in Parker.

title: Classic Rock Cruise-In Car Show
description: Come Downtown for the 10th Annual Classic Rock Cruise-In Car Show, Saturday, June 16, 2018 from 10am - 3pm! This event is brought to you in partnership between the Vintage Car Club of Castle Rock and Downtown Merchants Association. Look at over 300 cars, enjoy live music, free bounce houses and family activities with food vendors on site. Entrants can register at www.classicrockcruisein.com starting April 1, 2018.

title: An Evening with Sandra Dallas
description: NYT bestselling, award winning author Sandra Dallas will talk about her new novel The Patchwork Bride, which is her fifteenth novel.

title: Car Show Street Party and Concert
description: Come on Downtown to the Car Show Street Party and Concert, Friday, June 15, 2018, the night before the 10th annual Classic Rock Cruise-In Car Show from 6pm - 9pm. Enjoy live music, food and a preview of the classic cars at the Saturday show. Located on Wilcox Street between 3rd and 5th streets, under the lights.

title: Prepare to Hike the Summer Front Range
description: Prepare to hike the Front Range! Veteran hiker and author Pete K.J. joins us to talk about hiking strategies, equipment, safety and trails. Adults.

title: DCL Presents: Karen Kingsbury
description: Karen Kingsbury, New York Times bestselling author of the Baxter Family book series, will be our guest June 6th when Douglas County Libraries hosts her at CU South Denver. Tickets are $29, which includes reserved seating, a place in the signing line, dessert bites, and a hardcover copy of her new title, To the Moon and Back.

title: Cattle Crossing 5K and Family Fun Trek
description: The Cattle Crossing 5K and Family Fun Trek is a chance to grab your friends and family to run or walk and kick off the beginning of summer.

title: Festival Park Grand Opening and Starlight Movie NIght
description: Join us for the summer Grand Opening of Festival Park and the first Starlight Movie Night of the season. Festivities kick off at 2pm on June 2, 2018 in Festival Park, with live music from Sarah P and the Dirty Logger, food, bounce houses and family activities. Stick around for the Starlight movie night showing Jumanji, beginning at dusk.

title: Summer Reading Kickoff Party
description: Start summer off with a fun day at your library! Join us for life-size games, a live DJ, and a bouncy castle. Pick a book from our book fair, get snacks from local food trucks, and register for a summer full of fun! ALL AGES. REGISTER NOW.

title: Downtown After 5
description:
Friday nights in the summer are made for spending close to home, enjoying the beautiful weather, and unwinding from the long week. Why go anywhere else but Downtown Castle Rock?
On select Fridays throughout the summer months, head over to Festival Park for live music, great food, and a variety of beverages for the whole family to enjoy!

title: Writers Workshop: Publishing 101
description: Learn the ins and outs of self-publishing, including information about the industry, costs, steps for self-publishing, marketing, and more. Presented by My Word Publishing's Polly Letofsky, the workshop will take place May 30 from 6:30-8:30 pm at Douglas County Libraries in Parker. Bring your own notebook or laptop. For adults.

title: Senior Stroll
description: To celebrate National Senior Health and Fitness Day, Parker Parks and Recreation hosts the annual Senior Stroll. This free event consists of a one-mile fun walk on a paved trail, delicious refreshments, socializing with friends, along with great giveaways!

title: Introduction to Fishing
description: In cooperation with local angling experts, fishers of all ages will learn to bait, cast, tie knots, reel ‘em in and unhook the catch at Shea Stadium at 6 pm. Participants will receive a free fishing rod. Pre-registration is required at www.highlandsranch.org.

title: Highlands Ranch Metro District Board Meeting
description: The public is invited to attend the Highlands Ranch Metro District Board of Directors Meetings starting at 6 pm located at the Hendrick Office Building 62 Plaza Drive in Highlands Ranch.    The board will discuss issues on their agenda each month.  Agenda meeting notes and minutes can be found on www.highlandsranch.org.

title: Highlands Ranch Metro District Study Session
description: The public is invited to attend the district study session for the Highlands Ranch Metro District Board of Directors. Meetings are held in the Hendrick Office Building, 62 Plaza Dr in Highlands Ranch at 6 pm.  The board will discuss issues on their agenda each month.  Agenda meeting notes and minutes can be found on www.highlandsranch.org.

title: Renew the Ranch Community Cleanup
description: Join your neighbors and help clean up Highlands Ranch’s natural open space areas. Volunteers are needed to help pick up trash and keep our community beautiful. Contact Kari Larese at klarese@highlandsranch.org or 720-240-4909 for more information or to volunteer.

title: An Evening with Jessica Knoll
description: Jessica Knoll, author of NYT bestselling Luckiest Girl Alive, presents The Favorite Sister, a blisteringly-paced thriller. Books sold at event by Tattered Cover Book Store. Registration required.

title: Mother's Day Open Hours at the Mansion
description: Stop by the Highlands Ranch Mansion, 9950 E. Gateway Drive, for open hours from 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. on Mother’s Day. Enjoy self-guided tours and the elegant beauty of the historic property. Pack a picnic lunch to eat on the front lawn or wander through the beautiful 27,000-square-foot building.

title: Mother's Day Wildflower Walk
description: Join a native plant master and park ranger on a hike up to Highlands Point. Take in the view from the highest point in Highlands Ranch while learning about some of the native wildflowers that grow in the area. Also, discover various native bees that pollinate these wildflowers. Please leave your furry friends at home and wear sturdy shoes. Meet at the Red-tail basketball courts at 2:00 pm. Registration is required at www.highlandsranch.org.

title: Solo Piano with Stacey Rose
description: Join us on Saturday, May 12 at 8pm for Solo Piano with Stacey Rose. Captivating audiences across the world with her unique combination of virtuosity, beauty of tone, and musical sincerity, Denver native Stacey Rose projects true magnetism on today’s music stage. This performance will be a solo recital program of original compositions, representing Rose’s contemporary conceptions of traditional musical forms. For more information and to purchase tickets, visit www.lonetreeartscenter.org/staceyrose.

title: Cultural Arts Fair
description: Experience a variety of cultures through music, art and activities. Register to receive a schedule of the day's events. ALL AGES.

title: Computer/Electronics Recycling and Paper Shred
description:
The Highlands Ranch Community Association (HRCA) is hosting a Computer/Electronics Recycling event on Saturday, May 11, 2019 from 9:00 a.m. – 12:00 p.m. in the parking lot at Highlands Ranch Parkway and Lucent Blvd. (Kaiser Permanente Bldg.) in Highlands Ranch.   Electronic components contain materials that are very harmful to our environment.  
New:  Required admission fee of $5.00 per vehicle

E-Tech Recyclers will safely recycle the following types of electronic equipment:
• Palm Pilots • Printers • Keyboards • Fax Machines • Telephones • Cell Phones • Radios • Printers •   • Electronics • Palm Pilots • Computer Mice • Laptops • Stereos • Keyboards • Lamps •
• Fax Machines  • Telephones • Cell Phones  • Radios  • Auto Electronics  • Remotes •
• Laptops   • Stereos  • Vacuums  • Coffee Machines  • Microwave Ovens •
• DVR and VCRs  • Ipads and Tablets  • Compact Fax Machines  • Cable Boxes •  
• Wires and Cables  • Game Stations •

**check web site for most up to date items that are accepted and not accepted at the event

*Televisions and LCD and CRT Monitors for $ .60 per pound.

Relying on your personal shredder or using a regular waste disposal service may not ensure that sensitive information is being safely destroyed and can be more expensive than you think. Machines break down. Paper jams. When confidential paper hits the dumpster, what then? XpresShred will securely shred your sensitive documents on site. 
Limit of 3 small bags or small boxes of confidential paper (Additional small boxes/bags are $5 each.) Residential only. No trash, phone books, or newspapers please. 

Suggested donation of $20 benefiting the Highlands Ranch Cultural Affairs Association will be accepted.  For general event information call 303-791-2500 or visit www.HRCAonline.org/recycle.

title: Birding Walk
description: Enjoy a slow walk along the High Line Canal to Spring Gulch Pond at 9 am to discover some beautiful birds. Bring your binoculars and bird books if you have them. Please dress for the weather and wear walking shoes. Advance registration is required, go to www.highlandsranch.org.

title: Walk at Redstone Park (Part of Older Americans Month)
description: Celebrate Older Americans Month by participating in free activities throughout May during the Metro District’s Active Adult Month.  Meet at Redstone Park's Pond Shelter at 8:30 am. This is a free event. Pre-registration is required, goto www.highlandsranch.org.

title: DCL Presents Gretchen Rubin
description: Douglas County Libraries is pleased to host Gretchen Rubin, the New York Times bestselling author of The Happiness Project and Better Than Before and co-host of the award-winning podcast Happier with Gretchen Rubin." Ms. Rubin will talk about her new book
start_date: Inner Calm. A book signing will follow the author's presentation; additional books will be available for purchase courtesy of Tattered Cover Book Store. Ticket includes a hardcover copy of Outer Order
location: a seat at the author's presentation
city: and a place in the signing line."

title: Free Tree Limb Recycling Event
description: This annual spring tree limb recycling event is presented as a free service by the Highlands Ranch Metro District forestry staff. Recycle tree limbs and woody plant material on Sunday, May 6 from 9 a.m. until 1 p.m. in the parking lot at Redstone Park and Shea Stadium. Free mulch will also be available on a first come first served basis.

title: Spring up the Creek
description: Feeling anxious to get outside and enjoy the springtime weather? Plan to join your neighbors, fellow students, Town staff and other stream teams" at Spring up the Creek! This years Event is on Saturday

title: Classic Albums Live: Rumours
description: Come to the Lone Tree Arts Center on Saturday, May 5th at 8pm for Classic Albums Live: Rumours. Classic Albums Live recreates Fleetwood Mac’s Rumours with skilled vocalists and musicians who honor the work with no gimmicks, no make-up or other illusions employed by tribute bands. Rumours is one of the most popular and critically acclaimed albums released in the 1970s. Originally released in 1975, it contains many of the group’s greatest hits, including “Don’t Stop,” “Go Your Own Way,” “The Chain,” and “Dreams.” For more information and to purchase tickets, visit www. lonetreeartscenter.org/rumours.

title: Cinco de Mayo Street Party and Concert
description: Free, family-friendly street party and concert in downtown castle rock, May 5, 2018 from 5pm to 10pm. Live music, featuring swerve, bounce houses, family activities and food vendors on site. Located on Wilcox Street between 3rd and 5th streets.

title: An Evening with Mark Obmascik
description: Join  Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist and local bestselling author Mark Obmascik as he introduces his new biography, The Storm on Our Shores, April 30 . Learn about the incredible story of two WWII soldiers and “The Forgotten Battle” that raged in May 1943, during the Battle of Attu. A book sale and signing will follow the author’s talk.

title: West Side Story in Concert: Bernstein at 100
description: Join us at the Lone Tree Arts Center on Sunday, April 29 at 7pm for West Side Story in Concert. The Boulder Philharmonic Orchestra, in collaboration with Central City Opera and choirs, will perform one of the greatest scores in American musical theater, Leonard Bernstein's iconic West Side Story.It's a fun evening out for the whole family.For more information and to purchase tickets, visit www.lonetreeartscenter.org/westsidestory.

title: National Prescription Drug Take Back Day
description: Did you know that flushing or dumping medicine down a drain or toilet is not a good way to dispose of it?  Pharmaceutical residues have been detected in the drinking water of 24 major metropolitan areas across the country. Instead, drive through and turn in unused or expired prescription and over-the-counter medication for safe disposal at 9250 Zotos Drive April 28th from 10 am to 2 pm.   Items that can not be accepted include needles and sharps, mercury as in thermometers, oxygen containers, chemotherapy or radioactive substances, pressurized canisters and illicit drugs.

title: Local Author Showcase
description: Hear from 14 local authors as they talk about their books. Each author will spend 5 minutes discussing their work, followed by a book sale and signing. Light refreshments provided. Authors interested in presenting must fill out an application by emailing Lisa at lcasper@dclibraries.org

title: Spy School
description: Assess your spy skills and talents through a series of fun tests for agility, dexterity, memory, code-breaking, and lab forensics at DCL's renowned Spy Training Center. Do you have what it takes to enter the ranks of the world's most talented spies? Ideal for AGES 6-12.

title: Caturday Morning & Dog Day Afternoon
description: This pet extravaganza includes fun activities, crafts, pet adoptions, and more! For all ages.

title: Writers Workshop: Characters & World Building
description: Learn about world building and how to develop characters at this writers workshop, led by award-winning authors Warren Hammond and Angie Hodapp, April 25 from 6:30-8:30 pm at Douglas County Libraries in Parker. Bring your own notebook or laptop. For adults.

title: SFJAZZ Collective: The Music of Miles David and Original Compositions
description: Join us on Wednesday, April 25 at 7:30pm for the SFJAZZ Collective performing the music of Miles Davis and original compositions. The SFJAZZ Collective is an all-star award-winning band comprising eight of the finest performers/composers at work in jazz today. For more information and to buy tickets, please visit www.lonetreeartscenter.org/sfjazz.

title: An Evening with America's Librarian Nancy Pearl
description: America's Librarian and Author Nancy Pearl will talk about her novel George and Lizzie. Nancy is known for her appearances on radio, television and having her own librarian action figure. Books will be sold at the event.

title: An Evening with Lisa Scottoline
description: NYT Bestselling author Lisa Scottoline will talk about her new novel, Someone Knows, Friday, April 12 at 7 pm at Douglas County Libraries in Castle Rock. Books will be sold at the event courtesy of the Tattered Cover Book Store. Book signing to follow presentation.

title: FAN-tastic Fest: Pop Culture Con & Costume Fair
description: Celebrate pop culture and fandoms of all kinds and embrace your alter ego through cosplay. The fun will include geeky games, crafts, a photo booth, a fan art show, a costume parade, and an opportunity to let your inner hero (or villain) shine. Teens only from 5-8PM (registration required).

title: FAN-tastic Fest: Pop Culture Con & Costume Fair
description: Celebrate pop culture and fandoms of all kinds and embrace your alter ego through cosplay. The fun will include geeky games, crafts, a photo booth, a fan art show, a costume parade, and an opportunity to let your inner hero (or villain) shine. All ages from 1-5PM (drop-in)

title: August Wilson's Fences
description: Join us at the Arts Center in April for August Wilson's Fences. August Wilson is widely regarded as one of the finest playwrights ever to write for the American stage. His American Century Cycle, which traces the African-American experience through ten plays, each set in a different decade, stands as a staggering achievement. Fences, the sixth play in the Cycle, revolves around the life of garbage collector Troy Maxson and his family. Fences will run from Thursday, April 5th until Saturday, April 21st. For more information and to buy tickets, please visit www.lonetreeartscenter.org/fences.

title: Writers Workshop: Story & Plot
description: Learn methods for constructing your story and plot. This writers workshop will be led by Kevin Ikenberry, military science fiction writer and author of Sleeper Protocol and Vendetta Protocol. Bring your own notebook or laptop. For adults.

title: Mandy Gonzalez: Raise the Roof
description: Join us on Sunday, March 18 for an evening with Mandy Gonzalez. One of the most powerful and versatile voices in musical theatre, Mandy is now starring in the hit Broadway musical phenomenon, HAMILTON as Angelica Schuyler. With this performance, you can expect hit tunes like “Total Eclipse of the Heart,” “Breathe” (and, yes, “Defying Gravity”), as well as songs from Elvis to Aretha. For more information and to purchase tickets, visit www. lonetreeartscenter.org/mandygonzalez.

title: An Evening with Brad Meltzer
description: Brad Meltzer #1 NYT Bestselling author will talk about his thriller The Escape Artist. Book sales at the event courtesy of the Tattered Cover Book Store. Signing to follow presentation. Registration required.

title: An Evening with Author Chris Bohjalian
description: NYT Bestselling author Chris Bohjalian will talk about  The Flight Attendant, his new novel. Books will be sold at the event by the Tattered Cover Book Store. Book signing follows presentation.

title: An Evening with Steve Berry
description: The bestselling author will talk about his new Cotton Malone thriller, The Malta Exchange, which releases the same day, Tuesday, March 5 at 6:30 p m  at Douglas County Libraries in Parker. Be the first to get a copy! A book sale and signing will follow the author's talk. For more information and to register, visit dcl.org/authors-events.

title: Pradhanica
description: Join us on Saturday, March 3 at 8pm for Pradhanica. Dizzying spins, fast-paced footwork, immersive emotions, and dynamic drumming come together in this contemporary presentation of the Indian classical dance form of Kathak. Jin Won and Pandit Divyang Vakil delve deeply into how emotions are expressed solely through rhythm and movement, and explore the fundamental rhythmic connection between the dancer and music. For more information and to buy tickets, please visit www.lonetreeartscenter.org/pradhanica.

title: Downhill Colorado with Jon Kedrowski and John Fielder
description: Enjoy a hot toddy and learn to prepare for ski descents and winters with ski mountaineer Jon Kedrowski and photographer John Fielder. Both authors will talk about their books: Classic Colorado Ski Descents and A Colorado Winter. Books will be sold at the event.

title: Tuesday's with Tera
description:
Join Mayor Tera Radloff on Tuesday February 27 from 8:30 am to 10 am over coffee to ask questions and provide feedback about what's going on in the community. 
At this week's event, meet Michael Penny, Castle Pines' new interim city manager.

title: DCSD Board of Education meeting
description: Regular meeting of the DCSD Board of Education, beginning at 5:00 p.m.

title: Moscow Festival Ballet: Cinderella
description: Join the Moscow Festival Ballet at the Lone Tree Arts Center on Thursday, February 15th for Cinderella. This performance features a stunningly beautiful blend of storytelling, humor, splendid scenery and costumes, promising to make you believe in happily ever after. For more information and tickets, please visit www.lonetreeartscenter.org/cinderella.

title: Love 'em or Leave 'em Valentine's Day 5K/10K
description: The Love 'em or Leave 'em  Valentine's Day 5K/10K, held on Feb. 10 at 10 a.m. at Bar CCC Park, is the signature run/walk of the Parker Parks and Recreation Run Series and is a fun and festive workout!

title: Matt Dusk
description: Grab your sweetheart and head to the Lone Tree Arts Center on Saturday, February 10th from 8 to 10 p.m. for Canadian crooner Matt Dusk. Dusk’s live performances showcase his classy cool style, killer band, and his seemingly effortless way of taking his audiences on a journey through his music and his instantly distinguishable voice. For more information and to buy tickets, visit www.lonetreeartscenter.org/mattdusk.

title: Happy Birthday Castle Pines
description: Castle Pines is turning 10 in 2018! Celebrate the city and all it has to offer. Games, food, crafts and special guests will be at the library to celebrate the city's birthday.

title: PostSecret: The Show
description: PostSecret, the social media phenomenon, comes to life at the Lone Tree Arts Center on Thursday, February 8th at 7:30pm. PostSecret: The Show is an immersive, poignant journey through the humor and humanity of the personal stories we keep to ourselves, and on rare occasions, share with others. PostSecret is one night only at the Lone Tree Arts Center on February 8th. Visit lonetreeartscenter.org/postsecret for more information.

title: Douglas County School District Board of Education meeting
description: The DCSD Board of Education will meet on  Tuesday, February 6 at 5 pm in the Wilcox Administration Building, located at 620 Wilcox Street in Castle Rock. For more information, visit www.DCSDK12 .org.

title: DCL Presents: Jojo Moyes
description: Douglas County Libraries, in partnership with Tattered Cover Book Store, is pleased to host Jojo Moyes to talk about her latest book, Still Me.

title: Princess Ball
description: Your little princess will feel like the belle of this sparkling ball held on Jan. 26 at 6:30 p.m. at the PACE Center. Tiaras, dancing, refreshments and fun activities that will keep everyone entertained. There may even be a surprise visit from a favorite princess or two!

title: A Taste of Tea
description: Taste different teas offered by English Tealeaves.

title: DCSD Middle School Honor Band and Honor String Orchestra Concerts
description: Come hear student musicians across Douglas County perform in the annual Middle School Honor Band and String Orchestra concert, beginning at 5 pm at Castle View High School.

title: Riders in the Sky: A Tribute to Roy Rogers
description: Back by popular demand, join Riders in the Sky on Saturday, January 20 at 8pm at the Lone Tree Arts Center. This performance pays tribute to iconic western movie, music, and TV star Roy Rogers, the undisputed King of Cowboys." They're back for one night only on January 20th at 8pm. Find more information at www.lonetreeartscenter.org."

title: Country Line Dancing
description: Learn how to line dance with a professional instructor. Singles, couples, and families welcome. Refreshments provided.

title: Douglas County School District Board of Education meeting
description: Come join our regular meeting with the DCSD Board of Education, beginning at 5 pm. located at 620 Wilcox Street in Castle Rock.  For more information go to DCSDK12 dot org.

title: Planning Commission Meeting
description: Come join our Planning Commission Meeting  on January 11, 2018 6 p.m. at 100 North Wilcox Street, Castle Rock.

title: Castle Rock Town Council Meeting
description: Come join our Town Council meeting Tuesday, January 16, 2018, at 6 p.m. at 100 N Wilcox Street in Castle Rock.

title: Design Review Board Meeting
description: Jan. 10, 2018 6 to 8 p.m.  The Design Review Board reviews all development applications that require a Downtown site plan to achieve the goals and objectives of the Downtown Master Plan, the Downtown Overlay District and the Historic Preservation Plan.

title: Public Art Commission Meeting
description: Come join our Public Art Commission Meeting January 11, 2018,  at 4 p.m. at 100 North Wilcox Street in Castle Rock.

title: City of Castle Pines New Council Inauguration and Swearing In
description:
Celebrate with your local city representatives! Congratulate councilmembers as they begin and end their service to the community.

The City of Castle Pines cordially invites you to attend the final City Council meeting for outgoing members, and the inauguration of new members, on Monday, January 8, 2018, at 6:00 p.m. at 360 Village Square Lane.

Immediately following the 6:00 p.m. meeting, stick around for a reception in honor of Mayor Tera Radloff and the City's five newly elected council members:
-Melissa Coudeyras, Ward 1
-Ben Price, Ward 2
-Gregory Fisher, Ward 2
-Roger Hudson, Ward 3
-Tracy Engerman, Ward 3 

Be sure to RSVP to the reception, hosted by the Castle Pines Chamber of Commerce.
